title: Effects Education On Urban vs. Rural Population
text:
library(tidyverse)
library(rstanarm)
library(primer.data)


dataset <- read_csv("Data.csv") |>
  as_tibble() |>
  filter(Time == 2020)


x <- dataset |>
  mutate(Rural_PopPerc = `Rural population (% of total population) [SP.RUR.TOTL.ZS]`, Urban_PopPerc = `Urban population (% of total population) [SP.URB.TOTL.IN.ZS]`, Rural_PopGrowth = `Rural population growth (annual %) [SP.RUR.TOTL.ZG]`, Urban_PopGrowth = `Urban population growth (annual %) [SP.URB.GROW]`, Educ_Exp = `Government expenditure on education, total (% of government expenditure) [SE.XPD.TOTL.GB.ZS]`, Country_Name = `Country Name`)|>
  select(Time, Country_Name,
         Rural_PopPerc, Rural_PopGrowth, 
         Urban_PopPerc, Urban_PopGrowth,
         Educ_Exp)


data <- x |> mutate(Educ_Exp = as.numeric(Educ_Exp),
            Rural_PopPerc = as.numeric(Rural_PopPerc),
            Rural_PopGrowth = as.numeric(Rural_PopGrowth),
            Urban_PopPerc = as.numeric(Urban_PopPerc),
            Urban_PopGrowth = as.numeric(Urban_PopGrowth)) |>
            drop_na()
data

# A tibble: 159 × 7
   Time  Country_Name        Rural_PopPerc Rural_PopGrowth Urban_PopPerc
   <chr> <chr>                       <dbl>           <dbl>         <dbl>
 1 2020  Afghanistan                 74.0            2.77           26.0
 2 2020  Albania                     37.9           -2.88           62.1
 3 2020  Algeria                     26.3           -0.317          73.7
 4 2020  Andorra                     12.1            2.33           87.9
 5 2020  Angola                      33.2            1.33           66.8
 6 2020  Antigua and Barbuda         75.6            0.688          24.4
 7 2020  Argentina                    7.89          -0.540          92.1
 8 2020  Armenia                     36.7           -0.789          63.3
 9 2020  Australia                   13.8            0.389          86.2
10 2020  Austria                     41.3           -0.148          58.7
# ℹ 149 more rows
# ℹ 2 more variables: Urban_PopGrowth <dbl>, Educ_Exp <dbl>



fit_obj1 <- stan_glm(data = data,
            formula = Educ_Exp ~ Urban_PopGrowth,
            family = gaussian,
            refresh = 0,
            seed = 42)
  
fit_obj1

stan_glm
 family:       gaussian [identity]
 formula:      Educ_Exp ~ Urban_PopGrowth
 observations: 159
 predictors:   2
------
                Median MAD_SD
(Intercept)     12.5    0.6  
Urban_PopGrowth  0.7    0.2  

Auxiliary parameter(s):
      Median MAD_SD
sigma 4.7    0.3   

------
* For help interpreting the printed output see ?print.stanreg
* For info on the priors used see ?prior_summary.stanreg



fit_obj2 <- stan_glm(data = data,
            formula = Educ_Exp ~ Rural_PopGrowth,
            family = gaussian,
            refresh = 0,
            seed = 42)
  
fit_obj2

stan_glm
 family:       gaussian [identity]
 formula:      Educ_Exp ~ Rural_PopGrowth
 observations: 159
 predictors:   2
------

(Intercept)     13.7    0.4  
Rural_PopGrowth  0.4    0.2
